sen.e: The two men were tortured by being beaten by a stick; and, Kowamine was banished to Oki Province (later he was transferred to Izumo Province; details unknown), and Hayanari was banished to Izu Province.

sen.e: Hayanari died at the age of 60 some-odd-years old while he was being taken to Izu, at Hozuki District in Totomi Province (Today Honzaka, Mikkabi Town, Hamamatsu City).

sen.e: The daughter buried her father, became a nun and took the name Myochu, and built a thatched hut to grieve for her father.

sen.j: 桓武天皇の第8皇女伊都内親王が、生母藤原平子の遺言により、天長10年（833年）9月21日、山階寺東院西堂に香灯読経料として、墾田十六町余、荘一処、畠一丁を寄進されたときの願文である。
sen.e: This was written when Imperial Princess Gammon, the 8th daughter to Emperor Kammu, presented approximately 16 cho (cho = 0.99 hectares) of rice field, 1 vegetable field and a manor as a payment for light and the recitation of sutra to Toinseido of Yamashina-dera Temple, as requested by her mother, FUJIWARA no Heishi's will, on September 21, 833 by the old calendar.
